cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn N-NE on Wednesday and accelerate NE across GA/SC on Thursday, then track up the Mid-Atlantic coast toward New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast near the Steinhatchee River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch is currently posted north of Altamaha Sound, GA to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Dry Tortugas and along the west coast of FL northward to Ochlockonee River; Hurricane Warning Egmont Key to Steinhatchee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of FL, GA/SC Low-country, eastern NC, VA Tidewater, Delmarva Peninsula and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds 25-35 mph possible late Thu night–Fri as Elsa’s remnants pass just south of the Chesapeake Bay; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (≤4% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (≤1 ft) possible in upper Chesapeake Bay with persistent onshore flow; significant surge unlikely.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1-3 inches of rain expected Thursday night–Friday with locally higher pockets; could cause brief urban/terminal ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado risk in rain bands and temporary visibility restrictions; short-fuse severe weather possible.
